【考法 1】 vt. 限制：to limit narrowly; restrict
【例】Teammates circumscribed his en-thusiasm[ɪn'θjuːzɪæz(ə)m] so as not to make the losing side feel worse. 队友们抑制了他的热情为了不让失败者更难过。
【近】cap, limit, confine, delimit, restrict
【考法 2】 vt. 包围，围绕：to surround by or as if by a boundary
【例】fields circumscribed by tall trees 被高树包围的地方
【例】Circumscribe a circle around a square. 画正方形的外接圆。
【近】surround, encompass[ɪn'kʌmpəs]
